bibl.title: Aurelius Phoibammon, Son of Triadelphus: a Byzantine Egyptian Land Entrepreneur.
bibl.note: P. Michael. 43 (A.D. 526), P. Mich. XIII, 670 (A.D. 527) and P. Michael. 44 (idem) chronicle the economic advance of an Egyptian farmer, Aurelius Phoibammon, at the expense of an Egyptian soldier who was plunging ever more deeply in debt. Phoibammon is known from some dozen additional texts.
bibl.seg: Keenan James G., Aurelius Phoibammon, Son of Triadelphus: a Byzantine Egyptian Land Entrepreneur.

P. Michael. 43 (A.D. 526), P. Mich. XIII, 670 (A.D. 527) and P. Michael. 44 (idem) chronicle the economic advance of an Egyptian farmer, Aurelius Phoibammon, at the expense of an Egyptian soldier who was plunging ever more deeply in debt. Phoibammon is known from some dozen additional texts.
